original: Bergstrand, Karl Axel Magnus, provinsialläkare, bitr. förste provinsialläkare, järnvägsläkare, Växjö, f. 19/ 3/94 i Långasjö, Kronob. 1., av folk-skilär. Per Magnus B. o. Anna Hammargren. G. 1. 19 m. Bertha Nilsson; 2. 43 m. rektor Carin Lagerberg. Barn i Magnus Nils Axel Ingemar f. 23, Karl Bertil Yngve 26, Bengt Einar Sune 28, Finn Axel Hilding 32, Gerd Sylvia Anna-Beth 34, Sven Axel Magnus Lagerberg 44, Anna Carin Elisabeth 47. — Studiex. i Växjö 13, med. kand. i Lund 16, med. lic. i Sthlm 21. Studires. t. Tjeckoslov., Ryssl. o. Tyskl. E. läk. v. Säters hosp. 17, andre aman. v. Seraf ilas. kir. khn. 21, tf. aman. v. dess med. klin. 22, und iläk. v. Härnösands las. 22-24, därunder tf. las iläk. där tre mån., e. proviläk. i Gränna distr. 24-26, proviläk. i Söderåkra distr. samt läk. v. sjukst. där 26, skolläk. i Torsås 26-29, proviläk. i Växjö distr. samt bitr. förste proviläk. i Kronob. 1. sed. 41. Fältläk istip. 21, batiläk. v. Fik. 22-25, i res. 25-26. Fd. ordf. i Söderåkra hemb iför en., Kalmarbygdens körförb., Söderåkra Röda Kors-krets, barnkoloni, byggnifören. o. tenniskl., ordf. i Kronob. il. prov iläk ikl’. sed. 42. Kurator i Växjöstudenternas förb. Skr. i 15 upps. i med. ämnen samt art. i polit., kulturminnesv. m. fl. frågor i dagspressen.
translated: Bergstrand, Karl Axel Magnus, provincial physician, assistant first provincial physician, railway physician, from Växjö, born on March 19, 1894 in Långasjö, Kronoberg County, son of folk school teacher Per Magnus B. and Anna Hammargren. Married 1st in 1919 to Bertha Nilsson, and 2nd in 1943 to principal Carin Lagerberg. Children: Magnus Nils Axel Ingemar (born 1923), Karl Bertil Yngve (born 1926), Bengt Einar Sune (born 1928), Finn Axel Hilding (born 1932), Gerd Sylvia Anna-Beth (born 1934), Sven Axel Magnus Lagerberg (born 1944), and Anna Carin Elisabeth (born 1947). He graduated from high school in Växjö in 1913, obtained his medical degree from Lund University in 1916, and his medical license in Stockholm in 1921. He studied in Czechoslovakia, Russia, and Germany. He worked as a physician at Säters Hospital, Seraf ilas surgical clinic, Härnösand’s hospital, and Torsås school, and as a provincial physician in Gränna and Söderåkra District. He was a medical officer and battalion physician in the army, and was a former chairman of Söderåkra home insurance, Kalmarbygdens choir association, Söderåkra Red Cross district, children's colony, building association, and tennis club. He was the chairman of the provincial physician’s association in Kronoberg County since 1942. He also served as a curator for the Växjö student association and wrote 15 papers on medical topics as well as articles on politics, culture, and history in the newspapers.
